data.title: Pierce Berke's Post - LinkedIn
data.snippet:
Agree & Join LinkedIn

# Pierce Berke’s Post

View profile for Pierce Berke

I am humbled to announce my acceptance into the inaugural cohort of the Mammoth Leadership Academy for Spring 2025. I can't wait to grow as a leader and listener over the course of the 6-week program, and it was a pleasure speaking with President Michael Elliott at the Welcome Dinner last night!

No alternative text description for this image
No alternative text description for this image

Chris Tun, graphic

Great news Pierce!

Leo Anthony Duarte, graphic

Congrats Mr. Berke .

Matas Buitkus, graphic [...] Congrats Mr. Berke .

Matas Buitkus, graphic

Congratulations Pierce! I know this program will inspire growth in you as a future leader! Good luck and I hope it all goes well!

data.title: [PDF] Candidate Biographies - American Mathematical Society
data.snippet:
Additional Information: Four NSF research grants as PI, 2006–2010, 2010–2014, 2013–2016, 2018–present; AIM Human Resources board, 2008–present; Involve editorial board, 2011–present; Annals of Functional Analysis editorial board, 2013–present; Research Experiences for Undergrad-uate Faculty (REUF) advisory board, 2014–present; College Mathematics Journal editor search committee, 2016–2017; MAA Halmos–Ford Awards Committee, 2016–present; American Mathematical Monthly editorial board, 2017– present; MAA Invited Address Committee for the 2020 JMM, 2018–present; AMS Dolciani Prize for Excellence in Research, 2019; Fellow of the AMS, 2019. Five teaching awards: Pomona College, UC Santa Barbara 2x, UC Berke-ley 2x, article in The Best Writing on Mathematics, 2016 (Princeton), Erdo ˝s number: 2. [...] PhD: University of California, Berke-ley, 2001.
Selected Addresses: Plenary Speaker: International Conference on Natural Science, Mathematics, and Education, Korea Institute of Science and Tech-nology, Daejeon, Korea, 2015; Inter-national Workshop on Operator Theory and Applications (IWOTA), Washington University at St. Louis, Missouri, 2016; Plenary Speaker: WIMSIG Conference: Celebration of Women in Australian Mathematical Sciences, Australian Mathematical Society, Adelaide, Australia, 2017; Plenary Speaker: ICM Satellite Conference in Harmonic Analysis, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil, 2018; Geometric Aspects of Harmonic Analysis (GAHA), invited address, Cortona, Italy, 2018. [...] Courtesy of Dylan P. Thurston Courtesy of Maggy Tomova Election Special Section FROM THE AMS SECRETARY September 2019 Notices of the American Mathematical Society 1257 Member at Large of the Council Bianca Viray Associate Professor, University of Washington.
PhD: University of California, Berke-ley 2010.
AMS Committees: AMS-Simons Travel Grants Committee, 2018– 2021.

data.title: BIRTHDAY OF THE DAY: Rick Berke, founding executive editor of Stat
data.snippet:
us ‘Gilberke.’ So my career highlight came at the age of 17.” [...] How did you get your start in journalism? “It was in the third grade. I took the logo of ‘Life’ magazine, added ‘Berke’ to the ‘L’ and, voila, ‘Berke Life,’ my family newspaper, was born. The printing press was a copy machine at the Tenley-Friendship public library on Wisconsin Avenue. My career triumph came several years later when my classmate Mike Gill and I broke a story in Bethesda’s Walt Whitman High School ‘Black & White’ that Richard Nixon had been exposed to microwave radiation when he was Vice President during the kitchen debates in Moscow. It was shortly after ‘All the President’s Men’ had come out, and Mike and I were splashed in newspapers and on magazine covers around the world as ‘the young Woodstein.’ They called us ‘Gilberke.’ So my career highlight came at the age of [...] ## Most Read

1. Trump impeachment whistleblower Alexander Vindman launches Democratic Senate campaign in Florida
2. 'It's starting to turn against us': White House reckons with Minnesota fallout
3. Gun rights groups blast Trump over Minnesota response
4. Minnesota judge summons ICE leader to court, threatens contempt sanctions
5. The booby trap Eric Adams set for Zohran Mamdani
